definitions.definition: Moral badness; wickedness; malevolence; the forces or behaviors that are the opposite or enemy of good.
definitions.example: Evil lacks spirituality, hence its need for mind control.

definitions.definition: Something which impairs the happiness of a being or deprives a being of any good; something which causes suffering of any kind to sentient beings; harm; injury; mischief.
A malady or disease; especially in the phrase king's evil (scrofula).

definitions.example: an evil plot to brainwash and even kill innocent people
Do you think that companies that engage in animal testing are evil?

definitions.definition: Unpleasant, foul (of odour, taste, mood, weather, etc.).
Producing or threatening sorrow, distress, injury, or calamity; unpropitious; calamitous.
Having harmful qualities; not good; worthless or deleterious.
definitions.example: an evil beast; an evil plant; an evil crop
Global variables are evil; storing processing context in object member variables allows those objects to be reused in a much more flexible way.

definitions.definition: Injuriously, harmfully; in a damaging way.
Badly, poorly; in an insufficient way.
